intro: Taberna cymosa, commonly known as the wavy-leaved taberna, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. Taberna cymosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to gardens and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
